text:
Thanks, Obama. The White House just released a report showing job growth in 2015—and it confirms something Hillary Clinton has been saying for a while. 275,000 new private-sector jobs in Dec ?
Lowest unemployment rate in more than 7 years ?
https://t.co/CRMmfgSX9Q pic.twitter.com/G2HsplVmSf— The White House (@WhiteHouse) January 8, 2016 Even though Republicans don't like to admit it ...  We haven't seen this kind of growth since the last time we had a Democratic president in office. "You look at the last two years, it's the strongest two-year stretch of job growth since the late 90s." - @LaborSec on today's #JobsReport— US Labor Department (@USDOL) January 8, 2016 But we still have a lot of work to do. "The unfinished business of this recovery is to make sure that we have not only a better economy but a better America." - @LaborSec— US Labor Department (@USDOL) January 8, 2016 We can't afford to let a Republican rip away the progress we've made. Hillary will defend that progress—and build an economy that works for everybody, not just those at the top.
title: Press Release - Jobs Numbers From 2015 Confirm: the Economy Is Stronger With a Democrat in the White House
